result.execSummary:
The defendant Dexter Sallis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of payment, defendant to serve an additional 6 days jail, consecutive.  Apply 6 days sentence credit.  Costs are deemed PAID IN FULL.

Straight Time.
Apply 30 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
John Woodson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dexter Sallis in court, in custody (OTP'd from MSDF), with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
30 Days Credit.
Time Served.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid - FORTHWITH - In Lieu of payment -  6 days in the Waukesha County Jail - Consecutive - 6 Days Credit - Paid in Full.

Defendant to be returned to MSDF - FORTHWITH.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
From MSDF.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jim Fitzgerald appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dexter Sallis in court, in custody (by video from MSDF), with attorney Paul S. Crawford.

Defense is requesting a Plea and Sentencing Date.
Defendant to be OTP'd for the next court date by 11/06/17.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Detainer acknowledgement from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.
Detainer placed at: Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.
Hearing on October 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Dexter Sallis in court by video, in custody as MSDF, with attorney Paul S. Crawford.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will quash the capias.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant to appear by video from MSDF for the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to Appear, filed by Atty. Crawford.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Attorney Paul Crawford has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Bail/bond hearing on September 28, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dexter Sallis in court by video, in custody from MSDF.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that the defendant in not currently represented by counsel and asks the defendant if he had been notified from the public defender's office that they do not represent him anymore in this matter.  Defendant does not have the paper work to reapply for representation.  Court will have the clerk's office get the public defender's office forward paperwork to the defendant for representation.  Court will adjourn to allow time for the defendant to reapply for a public defender.  Defendant will appear by video from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 28, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from Atty Weathers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant
Bail/bond hearing on August 24, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
